title: User Management API Routes
description:
Create REST API Routes for User Management with Role-Based Authorization

Implement a complete set of REST API endpoints for managing user accounts with proper authentication and authorization controls.

Requirements:
- Create CRUD endpoints for user resources:
  - GET /users - List all users (admin only)
  - GET /users/:id - Get single user details (admin or self)
  - POST /users - Create new user (admin only)
  - PUT/PATCH /users/:id - Update user (admin or self, with different permissions)
  - DELETE /users/:id - Delete user (admin only)
- Implement middleware for authentication verification (JWT/session token validation)
- Add role-based authorization checks (e.g., admin, user roles)
- Validate request payloads and sanitize inputs
- Return appropriate HTTP status codes (200, 201, 400, 401, 403, 404, 500)
- Include proper error handling with descriptive messages
- Consider field-level permissions (e.g., users can update their own email but not their role)
- Add rate limiting to prevent abuse
- Write API documentation for each endpoint (request/response schemas)
- Include unit and integration tests for all routes and authorization scenarios

Edge cases to consider:
- Attempting to delete or modify your own admin account
- Accessing deleted/inactive user accounts
- Handling concurrent updates to the same user
- Password update workflows (require current password verification)
